text: Glorious leader, it seems our excavation hasn't gone unnoticed — the diggers have disturbed some long-forgotten prince, and now the dead rise to ensure his peace.
My most glorious leader, an excavation has uncovered a great tomb filled with riches. Should we begin securing the treasures?
A Norscan throng pillages through Nehekhara. While a Norscan this far south is rare, rumour has it this one knows the land all too well — and seeks revenge for his fallen master, Valgar the Butcher.
Our archaeological dig has been hampered by Ratmen attacks. Peculiarly, it seems these vermin are actually trying to defend the Nehekharan tombs.
Disgusting Tileans seek to plunder the lost Nehekharan wonders for their own personal gain, and see us as nothing more than barbarian obstacles.
Elves draped in dark clothing have been spotted nearby — no doubt seeking powerful Nehekharan relics for their own ruinous purposes.
We have stumbled across some hideous ritual involving blood, entrails, and pentagrams — but that seems to be the least of our problems. Whatever they were attempting may actually have worked...

The caravan led by #(caravan_master) has sold its wares in #(end_area) for #(pooled_resource.icon)#(amount). It will now begin the return journey to your capital.\\n\\nThe demand for trade goods in #(end_area) is now reduced, but will increase steadily over time.
